title: Trump charged with additional counts in Mar-a-Lago documents case
description: A new defendant was also added the indictment against Trump and his aide Walt Nauta. Carlos de Oliveira was added to the obstruction conspiracy charged in the original indictment.

title: LeBron James' son is released from hospital days after suffering a cardiac arrest
description: James committed to join the University of Southern California's basketball team in May. He was practicing with the team when he went into cardiac arrest.

title: Dads may want to do more caretaking — but then face barriers, one study finds
description: Fathers may want to take on more domestic and child care responsibilities, but gender norms and a lack of social support may discourage them from doing so, a new international study finds.

title: With Russia dominating the Black Sea, Ukraine's navy tries to rebuild
description: First, Russia wiped out Ukraine's navy. Now, Russia is blockading Ukraine's critical grain exports. As Ukraine tries to rebuild, NPR's Greg Myre got a ride on one of its few boats.

title: GM reverses its plans to halt Chevy Bolt EV production
description: The popular electric vehicle was released in the 2017 model year and had to be recalled twice due to battery issues. General Motors plans to only make electric vehicles by 2035.

title: After new law, Netanyahu vows to keep attorney general and return felon to office
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will not interfere in his corruption trial, vowing to keep the country's attorney general in place. But he considers reappointing a convicted cabinet member.

title: DOJ launches an investigation into Memphis and the city's police department
description: The Justice Department said its investigation will focus on the Memphis Police Department's use of force, its stops and arrests and whether the department engages in discriminatory policing.

title: Why it's so important to figure out when a vital Atlantic Ocean current might collapse
description: Scientists know a current in the Atlantic ocean could collapse suddenly as the climate changes. The question of when matters to billions of people around the globe.

title: Tornado damage to Pfizer factory highlights vulnerabilities of drug supply
description: A tornado that ripped through a Pfizer plant in Rocky Mount, N.C., raised worries about shortages of medicines used in hospitals. The drugs include commonly used painkillers and anesthetics.

title: New study shows just how Facebook's algorithm shapes conservative and liberal bubbles
description: Research conducted at the height of the 2020 election reveals new details about how Facebook's algorithms handle political content. But it suggests there are no easy fixes to political polarization.

title: 'Into the Bright Sunshine' spotlights the achievements of LBJ VP Hubert Humphrey
description: Humphrey is remembered for his defense of an unpopular war in Vietnam, but author Sam Freedman says the former mayor of Minneapolis played a critical role in getting Democrats to embrace civil rights.

title: Here's why Niger's coup matters to the U.S.
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken warns the U.S. partnership with Niger depends on "democratic governance and respect for the rule of law." Niger is vital to U.S. counterterrorism efforts in Africa.

title: Supreme Court OKs completion of Mountain Valley gas pipeline
description: The case involved an emergency challenge to the final stages of development of the 303-mile pipeline, which is to span from northwestern West Virginia to southern Virginia.

title: U.S. recovered non-human 'biologics' from UFO crash sites, former intel official says
description: Lawmakers heard first-hand accounts of craft that are "beyond our current understanding of our technology," and allegations that the U.S. recovered non-human "bio remains."

title: What my $30 hamburger reveals about fees and how companies use them to jack up prices
description: New fees are being tacked onto hotel bills, airfare, restaurant checks and pretty much everywhere else. It's another form of inflation and it's costing consumers $65 billion a year.

title: Wait, do you need a visa to go to Europe now? The new ETIAS requirements, explained
description: Starting in 2024, American passport holders traveling to 30 European countries will need to receive authorization to travel via the ETIAS, a long-awaited measure designed to prevent terrorism.

title: Biden is rolling out some new actions aimed at protecting people from extreme heat
description: On a very hot day in Washington, President Biden is meeting with mayors from cities grappling with the impacts of extreme heat, and announcing some new measures to try to help.

title: Up First briefing: Hunter Biden plea deal; coup in Niger, remembering Sinead O'Connor
description: A judge has put a plea deal in the Hunter Biden case on hold. Niger's military announced a coup. Irish singer Sinead O'Connor has died at 56.

title: Meta's Threads needs a policy for election disinformation, voting groups say
description: Twelve voting rights organizations tell Meta its new social media site Threads needs a robust plan to ensure election disinformation doesn't go viral during the 2024 elections.

title: America's farms are desperate for labor. Foreign workers bring relief and controversy
description: The number of H-2A visas for seasonal farmworkers issued each year has more than quadrupled over the past decade. The growth has alarmed labor advocates. Farmers don't love the program, either.

title: In Japan, a J-Pop star has come out as gay and his fans cheer
description: Shinjiro Atae shared the personal revelation on Wednesday evening with an auditorium filled with thousands in Tokyo.

title: Mattel tried to report financials. All anyone wanted to talk about was 'Barbie'
description: Mattel reported financial earnings Wednesday. Impacts from the Barbie movie remain to be seen, but she still stole the show.

title: Weighted infant sleepwear is meant to help babies rest better. Critics say it's risky
description: Parents are increasingly turning to weighted sleepwear to help lull their babies to sleep, but a growing number of doctors and safe sleep advocates warn it comes with risks that shouldn't be ignored.

title: His doctors billed Medicare late. Then he got sent to collections for the $3,000 tab
description: Medicare was supposed to cover the entire cost of his procedure. But the anesthesia provider failed to file its claims in a timely manner and billed the patient instead.

title: They billed Medicare late for his anesthesia. He went to collections for a $3,000 tab
description: Medicare was supposed to cover the entire cost of his procedure. But the anesthesia provider failed to file its claims in a timely manner and billed the patient instead.

title: A doctor leaves a lasting impression on a woman caring for her dying mom
description: When her mother was struggling with late-stage cancer, Julia had a conversation with a doctor that made her feel heard.

title: Actors take to the internet to show their residual checks, with some in the negative
description: The Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers rejected the SAG-AFTRA union's request for a separate type of residual payment that actors would get once their programs hit streaming services.

title: Is Barbie a feminist icon? It's complicated
description: The Barbie movie is being celebrated (and slammed) as a feminist film, with its themes of female empowerment and critiques of the patriarchy. Can the same be said for the doll at the center of it?

title: Singapore set to execute first woman in nearly 20 years, rights groups say
description: The announcement of the scheduled Friday execution of a woman comes as human rights groups say Singapore is out of step with the global trend of more countries moving away from capital punishment.

title: Whales beached in Australia are euthanized after rescue efforts fail
description: After a pod of nearly 100 pilot whales beached themselves on Tuesday, more than 50 of them died overnight. Now officials say the remaining 47 will be euthanized.

title: The three key moments in the U.S. tie with the Netherlands at the Women's World Cup
description: The top-ranked & two-time defending champion U.S. played to a 1-1 draw with the Netherlands. It was the first tie for the U.S. at the Women's World Cup since 2015 and was a rematch of the 2019 final.

title: Niger's military announces a coup on national television
description: The U.S. is calling for the president of Niger to be released after soldiers say they have seized power in a coup in the West African country.
